Ph.D. in Cinema Studies: Tisch School of the Arts at NYU                           Skip to content        Department of Cinema Studies _Copy Undergraduate Graduate MIAP Home Dual BA/MA Program Asian Film and Media Initiative (AFMI) Certificate in Culture and Media Financial Aid and Scholarships Course Offerings News & Events Faculty & Administration Alumni Cinema Resources Blog Announcements  home > Cinema Studies        Ph.D. in Cinema Studies  The Ph.D. curriculum draws on the methods of a number of disciplines, including art history, cultural studies, American studies, psychoanalytic theory, and philosophy. It involves intensive seminar level study in film theory, history and research methods. Graduates of the program have gone onto positions of academic leadership in the field. The Doctor of Philosophy degree is conferred for advanced studies in which the student demonstrates outstanding original scholarship. It signifies the student can conduct independent research and has both a broad basic knowledge of all areas of his or her field and an intensive knowledge of one field in particular. To apply to the Ph.D. program, please visit the Tisch Graduate Admissions page.    A doctoral candidate must complete all requirements no later than ten years from matriculation into the master’s degree program or seven years from the time of his or her initial matriculation if the candidate holds a master’s degree.    Course of Study    Students must complete 36 points of course work in addition to their M.A. degree (which will be assessed at 36 points) to total 72 points; three qualifying exams; a foreign language requirement; an oral defense and approval of dissertation proposal; and a doctoral dissertation. Students are permitted to take up to two classes outside the department or as independent study. Cinema Studies: Tisch School of the Arts at NYU                                Skip to content        Department of Cinema Studies _Copy Undergraduate Graduate MIAP Home Dual BA/MA Program Asian Film and Media Initiative (AFMI) Certificate in Culture and Media Financial Aid and Scholarships Course Offerings News & Events Faculty & Administration Alumni Cinema Resources Blog Announcements  home > Cinema Studies        35mm Projection Comes to Cinema Studies Since March 2010, the Michelson Theatre has been home to a pair of custom Kinoton FP20 35mm projectors.           more >          :: see next story 35mm Projection >               more         3rd Annual Experimental Film Lecture: Ken Jacobs The 2010 installment in the Experimental Film Lecture Series, presented with Undergraduate Film and Television, brought Ken Jacobs to the Michelson Theatre to present new work.           more >          :: see next story Ken Jacobs >               more         Marina Abramovic Lecture World renowned performance artist Marina Abramovic visited Cinema Studies in February 2010 to discuss work from her past and present.          more >          :: see next story Marina Abramovic Lecture >               more         MIAP  News and Events  MIAP Alumni Receive 4 of 10 Prestigious National Residencies  Cinema Studies Summer Courses 2015  New Cinema Practices in Southeast and East Asia            Undergraduate Admissions Graduate Admissions Academic Services Student Life Financial Aid and Scholarships Career Development Counseling Services International Students Incoming Students Graduation Forms What is Special Programs?
